result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M. Thunder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Good time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Order to Amend Report date from 9-17-15 at 8:00 pm to 9-9-15 at 8:00 PM

Defendant Jacob M. Thunder in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Remarks by Atty. Niemi.  Court makes findings and pronounces sentence.
Court gives right to counsel.  Adjourned to allow time for counsel.

Defendant Jacob M. Thunder not in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tag along w/15CT24.  Atty. Schenk represents a co-defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jacob M. Thunder in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Bond amended to add condition of no contact w/W. W.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
